title: Zork II: The Wizard of Frobozz

children.title: About

child.title: About PRIZM Invisiclues
child.content:
The PRIZM project (Pretty Reliable Invisiclues for Z-Machine) resulted from a collaboration between Digby McWiggle (digby_mcwiggle@hotmail.com) and Steven Marsh (marsh@netally.com, www.waitingforgo.com), with the aim of making the genuine Infocom invisiclues available as Z-Code computer files. The project was endorsed by Activision, who now hold the copyright for Infocom's material.

Whenever possible we have stayed faithful to the original printed Invisiclues booklets. Where both in-game and printed versions were available we have used the printed clues, as these were generally more detailed. Printing errors have been corrected whenever possible. The files have been formatted to display correctly on any screen with a width of at least 80 characters.

The home of the PRIZM project is www.waitingforgo.com. There you can download different versions of the files, with or without sample transcripts and missing documentation, and grouped by various classifications (unfortunately, limitations within the Z-Machine prevent all the invisiclues being packaged into one big file).

A large, portable source of heat might be useful.

You can lure the dragon into the Ice Room, thus solving two puzzles.

Only one of royal blood may approach a unicorn.

child.title: Can I kiss the Princess?

child.title: What do I do about the lizard doorkeeper?
hints: It cannot be killed.
It can be satisfied by a particular treasure.  When you find it, it should be obvious.

children.title: How do I move the menhir?

child.title: How do I move the menhir?
hints: Blasting will have no effect on it.
You will not be able to get past the large menhir until you have mastered the Wizard's power, which first requires solving most of the other puzzles in the game.
One way to move it is to use the wand to "float" it.
Another way is to ask the demon to move it for you.

children.title: What in the world do I do in the Oddly Angled Room?

child.title: What in the world do I do in the Oddly Angled Room?
hints: If you solve this without any help at all, my cap is off to you!
The maze was meant to confound maze mappers.

There are nine rooms.  Almost all of the room connections are probabilistic - sometimes they work and sometimes they don't. (If you repeat any direction often enough, you'll travel through all the rooms.)
Have you noticed all of the baseball clues:  the Babe Flathead bat, "You'll never get past first base at this rate..."?
The glowing diamonds are baseball bases - the brighter they glow, the further you've progressed.
Left-handed pitchers are sometimes called "southpaws."

The solution is to walk in the directions of a standard baseball diamond, starting from home plate (where the bat is):  southeast, northeast, northwest, southwest.  (It is admittedly a very difficult puzzle - apologies to non-American Zorkers).

children.title: How do I get out of the Small Room?

child.title: How do I get out of the Small Room?
hints: You came in through a door, didn't you?
Like most doors, the curtain door has two sides.
The other side of the door may not be apparent.
Try walking through the south wall.
Once the curtain door has closed, the only way out is to give the Gnome something valuable.  If you have nothing of value, you will be trapped forever.

children.title: How does carrying the portrait affect where I will end up?

child.title: How does carrying the portrait affect where I will end up?
hints: Any association between items you are carrying and the room to which the curtain door leads is purely coincidental.

children.title: How many places can I get to from the Depository?

child.title: How many places can I get to from the Depository?
hints: Seven, including four through the curtain.

children.title: How do I get into the vault?

child.title: How do I get into the vault?
hints: The curtain door leads to four locations.
It is completely deterministic (i.e., non-random).
The location to which it leads is determined by the direction from which you entered the Depository.

If you enter from the east, you will be transported to the East Viewing Room; if you enter from the west, to the West Viewing Room.  If you enter from the south (e.g., the Chairman's Office) you will be transported to the Small Room.
You can leave the Small Room by walking through the south wall (thus entering the Depository from the North).
If you enter the Depository from the north, you will be transported to the Vault.

children.title: How do I get out of the Vault?

child.title: How do I get out of the Vault?
hints: How did you get out of the Small Room?
Try the north wall.

children.title: What are the basket and canvas for?

child.title: What are the basket and canvas for?
hints: The canvas is attached to the basket, as is the receptacle.
You can get into the basket.
This is a deflated balloon.

children.title: Once I've determined what the basket and canvas are, how do I use them?

child.title: Once I've determined what the basket and canvas are, how do I use them?
hints: Once you inflate the balloon, you will find a card with instructions for use.  These items deal with inflation.
Not all balloons use hydrogen or helium.
Remember that hot air is less dense and therefore rises?
Burn something (such as the newspaper) in the receptacle.

children.title: How do I leave the top of the volcano without being killed?

child.title: How do I leave the top of the volcano without being killed?
hints: You don't, but isn't it a glorious death?

children.title: Which of the three paths down to the valley is best?

child.title: Which of the three paths down to the valley is best?
hints: Ask the scarecrow.
Beware of the lions and tigers and bears.
I suppose you'll soon be skipping and singing, "We're off to see the Wizard".
If you haven't guessed by now, this is a nonsense question.

children.title: What is the significance of the mines and smelter?

child.title: What is the significance of the mines and smelter?
hints: Have you tried processing ore?
Did you dig for the lode of mithril?

I find it amazing that you got this far, since there are no mines or smelters in Zork II. Keep in mind the warning in the introduction: Do not use the presence or absence of a question on a certain topic as an indication of what is important, and don't assume that long answers indicate important questions.

children.title: How do I extend the lava tube?

child.title: How do I extend the lava tube?
hints: This is not possible.

children.title: What do I do about the gnome?

child.title: What do I do about the gnome?
hints: The volcano gnome appears only if you are stranded on a ledge.  He will help you, but only for a fee.

children.title: How can I translate the books?

child.title: How can I translate the books?
hints: A Zorkish-to-English dictionary would be useful, wouldn't it?
So, of course, there isn't one.
You cannot translate them.

children.title: How can I open or remove the rusty old box?

child.title: How can I open or remove the rusty old box?
hints: It has an oblong hole chipped into it.
Nothing short of blasting will open it.  Someone seems to have done you a favor by creating a hole in which to place the bomb.

children.title: Who is M. Agrippa?

child.title: Who is M. Agrippa?
hints: Didn't he design the Pantheon in Rome?

child.title: The "Alice" Area

child.title: Can I get up the well, and if so, how?
hints: Yes.
What is a well for?
Have you tried putting water in the bucket?
Get in the bucket, then pour water in it.

child.title: What does the engraving say?
hints: It is the logo for a Frobozzco subsidiary.

{-}
obo obo
r z

AGI becomes f MAGIC z

E L WELL

mpa o n

children.title: How do I catch the magic mouse?

child.title: How do I catch the magic mouse?
hints: Have you tried using the green cheese?
There is no mouse.  Sorry.

children.title: Can the writing on the cakes be read?

child.title: Can the writing on the cakes be read?
hints: On all but one, it is too small to see with the naked eye.
Not even the robot can read it.
A magnifying glass would be useful.
Try reading it through the flask in the Pool Room.

children.title: Can the Mad Hatter be cured?

child.title: Can the Mad Hatter be cured?
hints: There is no cure for advanced mercury poisoning?
What Mad Hatter?

children.title: How do I get back down from here?

child.title: How do I get back down from here?
hints: The reverse of the way you got up.
If the bucket has gone back down, you're stuck.  The water evaporates in 100 moves.

children.title: What do the cakes do?

child.title: What do the cakes do?
hints: Experiment with them. Try eating them. You can't be afraid to try anything in Zork II (but you may want to SAVE your state first).
Reading them will tell you something.

children.title: What can I do with the flask of poison?

child.title: What can I do with the flask of poison?
hints: Kill yourself or others.
Examine it.
Examine it.  Look through it.  Use it as a magnifier to read the writing on the cakes.

children.title: How can I get the object under the water?

child.title: How can I get the object under the water?
hints: You cannot successfully enter the water.
There is no valve to drain the pool or plug the leak.
There is a way to make the pool evaporate.
Try throwing the red ("evaporate") cake into the pool.

children.title: How do I cross the chasm?

child.title: How do I cross the chasm?
hints: There is no way to cross while in your small state.
Once you return to normal size, the chasm will be a small crack again.

children.title: How do I control the robot?

child.title: How do I control the robot?
hints: Read the instructions.

children.title: What is EBCDIC?

child.title: What is EBCDIC?
hints: It stands for Extended Binary-Coded-Decimal Interchange Code, which IBM equipment often uses instead of ASCII (American Standard Code for Information Exchange).

children.title: What is a footpad?

child.title: What is a footpad?
hints: It is not a doormat.
Check the dictionary.
It means "thief" (i.e. you).

children.title: How can I take the red sphere?

child.title: How can I take the red sphere?
hints: Have you noticed that when the cage falls, you don't die immediately?
You have time to tell the robot to lift the cage (if he is in the room).

children.title: What do the buttons do?

child.title: What do the buttons do?
hints: If you push them, you are electrocuted.
You can experiment with them by ordering the robot to push them.
The buttons control the electromagnetic field which spins the Carousel Room.

The square button increases the spin to high speed.  The round button decreases the spin to low speed.  The triangular button flips the field from the Carousel Room to the Low Room, releasing the iron box and causing the carousel to stop spinning.  (Note: increasing the speed and flipping the field up to the Low Room is dangerous.)

children.title: The Wizard's Workshop Area

child.title: The Wizard's Workshop Area

children.title: Can I open the Wizard's trophy case?

child.title: Can I open the Wizard's trophy case?
hints: Not directly.
Treasures you were carrying when you died or which the Wizard has "filched" from you are kept in his trophy case.  If you acquire the Wizard's wand, you can "filch" them back.

children.title: How do I take the Wizard's wands from the wand rack?

child.title: How do I take the Wizard's wands from the wand rack?
hints: You don't.  They can't be taken.

children.title: What do I do with the yellow sphere?

child.title: What do I do with the yellow sphere?
hints: You've been fantasizing again.
There is no yellow sphere.

children.title: How can the owl be released?

child.title: How can the owl be released?
hints: The owl and the other memorabilia in the Trophy Room are protected by a powerful spell which cannot be broken.
No kidding!

children.title: What do I do with the black sphere?

child.title: What do I do with the black sphere?
hints: Have you tried looking into it?
The creature with the horrible face has freed you to return to your quest after dying.  Can you return the favor?
It has been alleged that demons are conjured up using pentagrams.
Try placing the black sphere in the pentagram.

children.title: Can the flying owl be caught?

child.title: Can the flying owl be caught?
hints: Don't you have your owl net handy?
The FANTASIZE spell does not include a flying owl.  Where did you see it?

If every question in this book were pertinent to the game, the questions themselves would give far too much away.  Questions such as this should convince you to ignore questions that are not of immediate use.

children.title: How do I detach the stands from the bench?

child.title: How do I detach the stands from the bench?
hints: You don't.

children.title: What are the stands for?

child.title: What are the stands for?
hints: Their colors should be revealing.
Rubies are red, sapphires are blue, diamonds are clear.
Try putting the crystal spheres in the appropriate stands.

children.title: Does the pentagram have any significance?

child.title: Does the pentagram have any significance?
hints: It has been alleged that pentagrams are used by wizards to conjure up demons.

children.title: What do I do with the palm tree?

child.title: What do I do with the palm tree?
hints: Admire its beauty.

children.title: How do I kill the serpent?

child.title: How do I kill the serpent?
hints: A fish out of water...
Have you tried breaking the aquarium glass?
As serpents are rather dangerous, you should stand far back and throw something at the glass.

children.title: How do I enter the aquarium?

child.title: How do I enter the aquarium?
hints: You might try typing:  ENTER THE AQUARIUM.
There is no way to enter the aquarium and live.

children.title: How do I satisfy the demon?

child.title: How do I satisfy the demon?
hints: Have you tried following his instructions?
If you have been wondering what to do with all the treasures, you now know.

You must give him the fancy violin, moby ruby, zorkmid coin, Flathead stamp, zorkmid bills, portrait, golden statuette, pearl necklace, gaudy crown, and golden key (minus any you had in your possession when you died or any that were "Filched" from you).

children.title: What do I do once I've satisfied the demon?

child.title: What do I do once I've satisfied the demon?
hints: You should as the demon to give you something.
It's something you need to finish the game; you've seen it but haven't been able to get it.
It's the wizard's wand.  Type:  DEMON, GIVE ME THE WAND, or DEMON, KILL THE WIZARD.

children.title: General Questions

child.title: General Questions

children.title: What is the object of this game?

child.title: What is the object of this game?
hints: Part of the object of this game is to discover the object of this game.
If you just keep solving puzzles, eventually you will find that you have finished the game.

children.title: What should I do with the treasures I've found?

child.title: What should I do with the treasures I've found?
hints: This is one of the puzzles you must solve.  It really doesn't matter where you keep them.  You will find out what to do with them later in the game.

children.title: What do I do about the Wizard?

child.title: What do I do about the Wizard?
hints: You need to discover and master the source of the Wizard's powers in order to complete the game.  Until you do, he will create a lot of mischief for you.

children.title: How many spells are there in this game?

child.title: How many spells are there in this game?
hints: There are 12 that the Wizard commonly casts on you.
There are seven others that have special purposes.
The 12 are FALL, FLOAT, FREEZE, FENCE, FIERCE, FERMENT, FEAR, FEEBLE, FUMBLE, FILCH, FANTASIZE, AND FIREPROOF.  The seven are FRY, FUDGE, FLUORESCE, FREE, FROBOZZ, FROBOZLE, and FROBNOID.

children.title: What does the FANTASIZE spell do?

child.title: What does the FANTASIZE spell do?
hints: Sometimes it causes you to see a bizarre object that isn't there in the room.

children.title: How do I cast a spell?

child.title: How do I cast a spell?
hints: You'll need a wand.
Read the white book.
Point (or wave) the wand at the object to be ensorcelled.  Then incant the spell (e.g. SAY "FLOAT")

children.title: Is there anything special about the spells the Wizard mumbles?

child.title: Is there anything special about the spells the Wizard mumbles?
hints: No.  They are the same ones he says aloud.

children.title: Where should I play the violin?

child.title: Where should I play the violin?
hints: Carnegie Hall?
Where is HELLO SAILOR useful?

children.title: How can I get the pearls back from the housekeeper?

child.title: How can I get the pearls back from the housekeeper?
hints: What housekeeper?
Are you sure that you are playing Zork II?

children.title: How do I get past Cerberus?

child.title: How do I get past Cerberus?
hints: The FIERCE spell is not recommended.
The FLOAT and FEEBLE spells are not strong enough.
Even the demon can't overcome him (them?).
Try taming him by putting on his collar.
The collar is found behind the menhir.

children.title: Where does saying HELLO AVIATOR cause something to happen?

child.title: Where does saying HELLO AVIATOR cause something to happen?
hints: The same place HELLO SAILOR and HELLO FOOTPAD cause something to happen.
Nowhere.

children.title: What do I do for light when my lamp runs out?

child.title: What do I do for light when my lamp runs out?
hints: If you have over 200 points and are in the dark with a burned-out lamp, wait for the Wizard to arrive.  He will cast the FLUORESCE spell and you won't need a light source (however, there are unfortunate side effects).

children.title: Can the demon help me?

child.title: Can the demon help me?
hints: He is mightier than the Wizard.
He will help you if you help him.
Once you have satisfied him, he will perform a deed for you.
Ask him to give you the wand or to move the menhir.

children.title: Where do I find the white sphere?

child.title: Where do I find the white sphere?
hints: Try looking into the blue sphere?
It is actually clear, not white.

For any man with half an eye
What stands before him he may spy
But optics sharp it needs and keen
To see what is not to be seen
--"Sleuth"
Clear glass is invisible under water.
It is in the aquarium.

children.title: Are the spheres useful for anything?

child.title: Are the spheres useful for anything?
hints: What if they were called crystal balls?
Have you tried examining them?
Try looking through them.
When you look into one, you see the view from the next one in the chain (somewhat like the palantirs in The Lord of the Rings).

children.title: How many spheres are there?

child.title: How many spheres are there?
hints: Have you ever died in Zork II?
There are four.
You will create the fourth with the first three.

children.title: What do I do with the perfect rose?

child.title: What do I do with the perfect rose?
hints: Admire it's beauty.
Must something so beautiful have any other use?

children.title: How do I go down the staircase landing without being killed?

child.title: How do I go down the staircase landing without being killed?
hints: In later releases (revisions) of the game, the landing is guarded by "magical" runes.
"Magical wardens," "green lines of enormous power," "close in on you as if searching for something.
You may proceed down the stairs and to the finish if you are carrying the Wizard's wand.

children.title: What do I do with the heads on poles?

child.title: What do I do with the heads on poles?
hints: We suggest that you not disturb the remains.
Let the dead rest in peace.

children.title: What is the significance of "Feel Free"?

child.title: What is the significance of "Feel Free"?
hints: Both words begin with an "F".
This is an inside joke.  It is what one Implementor says to another Implementor offering suggestions for changes in a game.  It has no significance.

children.title: I have all the points but somehow don't feel finished.  What do I do?

child.title: I have all the points but somehow don't feel finished.  What do I do?
hints: Type:  SCORE
The grue repellent label is a very subtle hint.
The Crypt is a "place of death."
It is too light to see the door to Zork III.
When the crypt is dark, the door is visible.  (Of course, the crypt will never be dark if you are fluorescing.)  In release 18 and later, you will need to be carrying the wand also.

children.title: I've finished the game but don't have all 400 points.  What's going on?

child.title: I've finished the game but don't have all 400 points.  What's going on?
hints: Don't let it bother you.  You have really completed the game.
Treasures in the Wizard's trophy case are not required to satisfy the demon.  Each treasure not give to the demon will leave you with fewer points.

children.title: I haven't finished the game and I don't have all 400 points.

child.title: I haven't finished the game and I don't have all 400 points.

child.content:
Have you tried:
  • setting off the bomb in the Dusty Room and then waiting in the balloon tied to the ledge?
  • petting or killing Cerberus after putting on his collar?
  • removing Cerberus' collar?
  • attacking the Princess?
  • taking the serpent?
  • diagnosing yourself while under certain spells?
  • waiting around the Topiary?
